para.text: In this chapter, the following term has the meaning indicated.
Term Defined. “Practice dentistry” means to:
Be a manager, a proprietor, or a conductor of or an operator in any place in which a dental service or dental operation is performed intraorally;
Perform or attempt to perform any intraoral dental service or intraoral dental operation;

Diagnose, treat, or attempt to diagnose or treat any disease, injury, malocclusion, or malposition of a tooth, gum, or jaw, or structures associated with a tooth, gum, or jaw if the service, operation, or procedure is included in:
The curricula of an accredited dental school; or
An approved dental residency program of an accredited hospital or teaching institution;
Perform or offer to perform dental laboratory work;
Place or adjust a dental appliance in a human mouth; or
Administer anesthesia for the purposes of dentistry and not as a medical specialty.
A dentist shall practice dentistry as defined in Regulation .01 of this chapter.
A dentist shall:
Limit their practice to the areas of competence by which proficiency has been gained through education, training, and experience;
Acquire the special education and training needed to address the cultural differences of diverse populations;
Avoid unfair discrimination based on age, gender, race, ethnicity, culture, national origin, disability, socioeconomic status, or other basis proscribed by law;
Use treatment only when the dentist knows that the circumstances are appropriate;
Maintain competence by meeting the requirements of continuing education in accordance with COMAR 10.44.22;
Engage in ongoing consultation with other dentists or relevant professionals;
Seek appropriate education, training, and experience when developing competence in a new service or technique; and
Document and maintain appropriate records of all relevant course work and training used to gain competence.
